LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.0: The most important part of a mortar squad is an experienced spotter with a good pair of binoculars.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.1: If your colonist can't hit the broad side of a barn, perhaps they are vision-impaired, less conscious or they weren't told to aim their shots.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.2: Fewer things are deadlier than a well-prepared kill zone.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.3: Simple, durable projectiles such as steel or plasteel arrows can survive the force of impact to be re-used by you or your enemies.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.4: Select a colonist carrying medicine and right click a downed comrade (or foe) to ordered them to "stabilize" the target, temporarily stanching their bleeding.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.5: Stabilizing someone temporarily staunches their bleeding, but it does not treat the wound. How long it lasts depends on the medic's skill.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.6: Bloodloss is often as fatal as the enemy fire. Tend to the wounded quickly to save allies and capture foes.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.7: Some weapons, such as one-handed pistols and melee weapons, can be used in conjuction with a shield, although doing so will expose the users arms.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.8: Centipedes are extremely well armored mechanoids, intended to shrug off small arms fire and break defensive lines. Defeating them requires special weapons and tactics.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.9: Stockpiling ammunition close to your emplacements keeps it handy during combat. Just watch out for cook-off!
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.10: Targets are more difficult to spot in darkness, but shooters aren't penalized for being in the dark. Light 'em up!
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.11: Good sights can help negate inaccuracy due to bad weather, darkness, or dense smoke.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.12: Shooters imperfectly lead their targets until they commit to a shot. Slower projectiles can be dodged.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.13: Some weapons, such as shotguns, are often reloaded one round at a time, allowing them to be fired mid-reload.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.14: Even when a projectile doesn't penetrate a character's armor, they may still be injured by the force of the impact.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.15: Even when behind cover, a shooter's head will still be exposed as they scan for targets.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.16: The longer a wound remains untreated, the higher the risk of infection. Lying in the dirt doesn't help things either.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.17: Your chance to hit, parry, dodge or land a critical hit in melee is a comparison between your and the enemy skill. The higher the difference in skill levels, the bigger the disparity.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.18: Your choice of weapon significantly affects your change to hit, parry, dodge or land a critical hit.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.19: Melee weapons can score critical hits. Blunt weapons will inflict a short stun, sharp weapons double their armor penetration, and animals knock down their target.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.20: Heavy, blunt melee weapons may defeat thick armor when edged weapons fail.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.21: Scoring a critical hit on a parry gives you a free riposte attack.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.22: Characters under enemy fire will become suppressed, diminishing their effectiveness in combat. Under especially heavy fire, they will seek cover and hunker down to avoid being killed.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.23: Projectiles will generate suppression enemies along their entire trajectory.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.24: Suppressed characters are indicated with a yellow downwards arrow. Suppression incurs mood debuffs, prevents aiming shots, and lowers accuracy.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.25: Hunkering characters emit an orange downwards arrow and dive for the nearest cover, where they build courage to return to the fight.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.26: Armor and specialized items like war masks make characters less suceptible to supression.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.27: Armor-piercing ammo offers superior armor penetration, but less damage than FMJ. The reverse is true for Hollow-Points.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.28: Shotguns can fire a variety of special ammunition types, such as EMP and non-lethal beanbags.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.29: Guns vary in calibre, accepted ammo types, long-range accuracy, magazine size.. Find out more by reading their information tab!
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.30: Thick armour instills courage against small arms fire, but its bulkiness reduces work speed.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.31: You can rely on enemies to drop ammunition, or you can craft it yourself at a machining table or a loading bench.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.32: Prometheum can be harvested from Blazebulb plants to create power incendiary weapons. But beware, high temperatures will cause them to combust!
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.33: Boomalopes can be milked for FSX, a volatile compound used to manufacture various explosives.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.34: Cold climates benefit are favourable for growing blazebulbs, where less cooling is required to prevent them from combusting.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.35: Warm climates benefit are favorable for rearing boomalope and boomrat, which struggle in harsh winter conditions.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.36: Prometheum-based flamethrowers and Molotovs will soak their targets and cause even normally non-flammable enemies to burn.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.37: Incendiary mortar shells will airburst and set fire to large areas.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.38: Prometheum is a self-igniting liquid that sticks to surfaces, and is impossible to extinguish without firefoam.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.39: It's not just carried items that count against your colonists' carry weight. Clothes and armor slow them down too.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.40: Colonists wearing bulky clothing or carrying bulky equipment will work more slowly.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.41: Precipitation, wind direction and speed all have a significant effect on fire spread. Beware of being downwind from a bush fire.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.42: Fires in confined spaces will create clouds of lethal smoke, capable of rapidly incapacitating anyone caught in it. Use gas masks to protect yourself.
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.43: Use loadouts to determine what your colonists should carry in their inventory. Use the equipment tab to access items
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.44: Embrasures provide a safer, but not impenetrable, location to lay down machinegun fire on assailants. Be sure to wear a helmet when peeking over them!
LanguageData.CombatExtendedCoreTips.tips.45: Auto-turrets are can be crafted with a machining table or bought from merchants. They will fire automatically, but must be reloaded manually.
